channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 令人惊讶的是，美国堕胎总数增长的很大一部分是支持性州居民堕胎数量增加的结果。这种增长至少在某种程度上可能是这些州努力改善堕胎机会的结果👇。
item.description:
A surprisingly large part of America’s total growth in abortions is the result of increases among residents of supportive states.

This growth is likely to be, at least to some extent, the result of efforts to improve access in such states https://t.co/xVls41kST8 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: "一位专家警告说："俄罗斯和乌克兰的网络战争正变得比以往任何时候都更具侵略性，未来还将继续扩大，可能会对关键......目标造成更大的破坏。但到目前为止还没有人获胜 👇
item.description:
“The Russia-Ukraine cyber war is becoming more aggressive than ever and will continue to expand in the future to potentially more devastating critical…targets,” warns an expert. But so far no one is winning https://t.co/H16AaNZaEh 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 这位前总统的新政党可能会使南非即将举行的选举成为种族隔离制度结束以来影响最大的一次选举。
item.description:
The former president’s new party could help make South Africa’s upcoming election the most consequential since the end of apartheid https://t.co/8TheqBdNRL

Photo: Reuters pic.twitter.com/e2kEBnargt

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰需要的盟友必须是大手笔、大军费，并果断地站在自己一边。目前的情况是，欧洲国家要么太小而不重要，要么太穷而帮不上忙，要么太犹豫而不愿意使用自己的力量--如果不是三者兼而有之的话👇。
item.description:
Ukraine needs allies that are hefty, big military spenders and decisively on its side. As things stand, European countries are either too small to matter, too broke to help or too hesitant to use their power—if not all three https://t.co/ADQ5neUTlI 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 葡萄牙被奉为毒品自由化的典范。葡萄牙的政策和荷兰的类似政策被认为扭转了 20 世纪 80 年代和 90 年代流行的吸毒现象。但是，第二种想法正在兴起👇。
item.description:
Portugal is held up as a model of drug liberalisation. Its policy, and similar ones in the Netherlands, are credited with reversing epidemics of addiction in the 1980s and 1990s. But second thoughts are rising https://t.co/wRCB8xc0Yg 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 欧洲正在为工人提供更多的育儿假。德国将很快成为最后一个引入陪产假的欧盟成员国👇。
item.description:
Europe is giving more parental leave to its workers. Germany will soon become the last EU member state to introduce paternity leave https://t.co/YuGnh87WB8 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 研究发现，与没有横向调动的员工相比，开始横向调动的员工在职业生涯后期更有可能获得晋升，并享受更高的工资增长。先横向流动，才能向上发展🦀。
item.description:
Research has found that employees who embark on lateral moves are more likely to be promoted and to enjoy higher wage growth later in their careers than employees who did not.

You can move up by first moving sideways https://t.co/lPtQFr8efg 🦀

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 墨西哥有数万人失踪。当局没有在寻找他们，而总统却在抹杀他所取得的一点点进展👇。
item.description:
Tens of thousands of people are missing in Mexico. The authorities are not looking for them, and the president is undoing what little progress he made https://t.co/kWYwfiArtV 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: "政权 "是一部愚蠢的电视剧，却严肃地揭示了专制的本质。Elena Vernham（凯特-温斯莱特饰演）和她的国家是真实人物和地点的狡猾合成👇。
item.description:
“The Regime” is a silly TV show that makes serious points about autocracy. Elena Vernham (played by Kate Winslet) and her country are sly composites of real people and places https://t.co/3aMSq679R9 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 管理一家陷入困境的地区性银行，与策划收购 TikTok 相比，简直是小菜一碟 👇
item.description:
Managing a struggling regional bank is light work compared with engineering a buy-­out of TikTok https://t.co/bKTinp5RVr 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 美国对苹果公司的最新诉讼围绕着该公司对竞争对手的所谓压制。不过，这家 iPhone 制造商可以从中得到安慰的是，美国政府最近在法庭上击败大型科技公司的几次尝试都失败了。
item.description:
America’s latest case against Apple centres around the firm’s supposed stifling of rivals.

But the iPhone-maker will take solace from the fact that the government has flubbed some recent attempts to defeat big tech in court https://t.co/HGUT8qXjOO 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 日本的货币政策发生了惊人的转变。但是，如果您仔细观察，就会发现一切并不像看上去的那样👇。
item.description:
In a remarkable turn, Japan has switched up its monetary policy. There is a sense that change is here to stay.

But if you take a closer look, all is not as it seems https://t.co/KlxDctKlXe 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 钱有可能太多吗？两本新书这样认为。但是，它们主张摒弃富人的论点简单、振奋人心，而且是错误的 💰
item.description:
Is it possible to have too much money? Two new books think so. But their arguments for doing away with the rich are simple, rousing and wrong https://t.co/7AY3zawNQ1 💰

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: "没有人注定只投民主党或共和党的票"来自@NALEO的阿图罗-巴尔加斯（Arturo Vargas）在 "制衡 "节目中说，美国拉美裔的选票将在11月被争夺。
item.description:
“No one is predestined to vote only as a Democrat or only as a Republican.”

Arturo Vargas from @NALEO says America’s Latino vote is up for grabs in November, on “Checks and Balance” https://t.co/MAL0a0kKgy 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 美国终于达成了预算协议，结束了漫长的争论，避免了政府关门的痛苦。谁是赢家，谁是输家？ 👇
item.description:
America at last reached a budget deal, ending a long saga and avoiding a painful government shutdown. Who are the winners and losers? https://t.co/FwwwPjU4XB 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 美国国会终于在本财政年度开始近六个月后通过了一项预算。但这并不意味着国会议员应该拍手称快👇。
item.description:
America’s Congress finally managed to pass a budget, nearly six months after the start of the fiscal year. That doesn’t mean its members should be patting themselves on the back https://t.co/qCNruECVy0 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 加沙停火谈判的破裂可能会使以色列走向无休止的占领、强硬的右翼政治和孤立的暗淡轨迹。美国必须帮助以色列找到更好的和平战略。如果失败，以色列本身将付出沉重的外交代价
item.description:
A breakdown of ceasefire talks in Gaza could put Israel on a bleak trajectory towards endless occupation, hard-­right politics and isolation. America must help it find a better strategy for peace. If it fails, it will itself pay a heavy diplomatic price https://t.co/T6GmXBW1dr

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 肥胖症在印度呈上升趋势。印度拥有 14 亿人口，肥胖问题的规模比其他任何地方都要严重。印度有 14 亿人口，肥胖问题的规模比其他任何地方都要严重。
item.description:
Obesity is on the rise in India. With a population of 1.4bn, the scale of the problem is greater than anywhere else. And several factors, some of which are unique to the country, make it fiendish to solve https://t.co/iyGNNb319t 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 几十年来，以色列的安全理论有三大支柱：威慑、预警和决定性胜利。现在，这三大支柱都已崩溃。半年的战争让以色列人感到更不安全，而不是更安全 👇。
item.description:
For decades, Israel’s security doctrine has rested on three pillars: deterrence, early warning and decisive victory. All three have now crumbled.

Half a year of war has made Israelis feel less safe, not more https://t.co/pcjEGeXoyM 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 对 TikTok 的禁令可能会导致许多其他流行的中国应用程序被扔进数字垃圾箱👇。
item.description:
A ban on TikTok could open the door to many other popular Chinese apps being consigned to the digital dustbin https://t.co/deKUjHfZs1 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 怪诞经济学》通过以作弊的相扑选手和赚取最低工资的毒贩为主角的小故事，探讨了如何利用新颖的数据来揭示驱动人们行为的真正原因。它很有趣，但并没有改变经济学👇。
item.description:
Through vignettes featuring cheating sumo wrestlers and minimum-wage-earning crack dealers, “Freakonomics” explored how the use of novel data can uncover what is really driving people’s behaviour.

It was fun, but did not transform economics https://t.co/lA0RMK91DD 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 在过去的 180 年里，我们帮助读者掌握了从技术到地缘政治、金融和经济等领域的巨大变革动力。您关注了吗？用我们的新历史游戏👇 来测试您的知识水平吧
item.description:
Over the past 180 years we’ve helped readers grasp the great drivers of change, from technology to geopolitics, finance and economics.

Have you been paying attention? Test your knowledge with our new history game https://t.co/Cu1vvSJjiR 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 当局称，至少有 140 人在周五晚莫斯科音乐厅发生的恐怖袭击中丧生。伊斯兰国声称对此负责，但在周六下午的讲话中，普京试图将乌克兰牵扯进来👇。
item.description:
Authorities have said at least 140 people died in the terror attack in a Moscow concert hall on Friday night. Islamic State has claimed responsibility, but in a Saturday afternoon address Vladimir Putin tried to implicate Ukraine https://t.co/5mF9gGDkFu 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 在许多富裕国家，年轻女性正变得越来越自由，而她们的男性同龄人却并非如此。这些不同的世界观可能会影响政治、家庭和更多 👇。
item.description:
In many rich countries, younger women are becoming sharply more liberal while their male peers are not. These diverging worldviews could affect politics, families and more https://t.co/VYhl3MhJ7y 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 美国联邦储备委员会选择维持 2024 年三次降息的预期，但将 2025 年的降息预期从四次下调至三次。
item.description:
America’s Federal Reserve has opted to maintain its outlook for three interest-rate cuts in 2024, though it lowered its projection for 2025 to three cuts from four.

An important gap in inflation measures sheds light on the central bank’s rationale: https://t.co/9fljAUxlal 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 研究人员使用人工智能模型预测哪位足球运动员会在角球开出后首先触球，准确率与人类专家相差无几： Rex Shutterstock
item.description:
Researchers used an AI model to predict which footballer would wind up making first contact with the ball after a corner kick, with similar accuracy to human experts: https://t.co/CeCgo3oFRW

Photo: Rex Shutterstock pic.twitter.com/T7eOwhjlzz

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 与缅甸军政府作战的少数民族和民主力量比以前更加团结。如果得到足够的外部支持，他们或许就能开始为没有将军的未来奠定基础👇。
item.description:
The ethnic and democratic forces fighting Myanmar’s junta are more united than before. With enough support from outside, they may be able to start laying the groundwork for a future without the generals https://t.co/NyqO663Kat 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 这七本书表达了战争的全部内容，从徒手搏斗的恐怖到永远无法愈合的情感伤痕Ὅ。
item.description:
These seven books express the full ambit of war, from the terror of hand-to-hand combat to the emotional scars that never heal https://t.co/SVCEDMa4wM 📚

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 从经济角度看，吉布提是一个附属于国家的港口，在军事房地产方面经营着利润丰厚的副业。自从胡塞武装开始在红海发动袭击以来，该国一直在努力应对延误和价格上涨问题。但人力成本又如何呢？
item.description:
In economic terms Djibouti is a port with a state attached, which runs a lucrative sideline in military real-estate.

Since Houthi attacks began in the Red Sea, the country has been grappling with delays and rising prices. But what of the human cost? https://t.co/DwTRFv6aAr

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024

item.title: 雅各布-祖马曾经说过，非洲人国民大会将统治南非 "直到耶稣再来"。但这位前总统的第二次降临可能会对南非大选产生举足轻重的影响👇。
item.description:
Jacob Zuma once said that the African National Congress would rule South Africa “until Jesus comes back”. But it is the second coming of the former president that could have a pivotal impact on the country’s election https://t.co/eXVwUBDLi1 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 23, 2024
